title: There needs to be a report called "Doesn't take Ranked serious".
body: We really really really really need this please. It wont ban them. It will just restrict them to normals. That is it.

replies.body:
How serious should someone take rank?

Do I have to play top tiered champions only or can I play something that's been working in normals?
Do I have to follow the standard build path or can I put my own twist on it?
Can I surrender or is that not taking it seriously enough?

The list goes on and on.

TLDR: Bad idea is bad.

As long as we have the standard 1/1/2/jg lanes I couldn't care what you build so long as you have experience with whatever strategy you are about to use.

Hell i've been carried by AD jg malzahar.

> [{quoted}](name=Daedalus871,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=6EnZrfus,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-04-02T04:49:08.779+0000)

> How serious should someone take rank?
> 
> Do I have to play top tiered champions only or can I play something that's been working in normals?
> Do I have to follow the standard build path or can I put my own twist on it?
> Can I surrender or is that not taking it seriously enough?
> 
> The list goes on and on.
> 
> TLDR: Bad idea is bad.

What do you consider negative attitude?

Is telling an ally that they made a mistake negative attitude?
Is saying let them have dragon negative attitude?
Is saying that we wont win early game negative attitude?

Anything can be blown out of proportion. There just needs to be a baseline on what is considered serious.

Explain to me why a game should be taken seriously? Nothing bad happens if you lose.

I'm also curious as what you think isn't serious enough for ranked, but is fine for normals, as you should always do your best to win regardless of the game mode.

> [{quoted}](name=Daedalus871,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=6EnZrfus,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-04-02T04:49:08.779+0000)
>
> Do I have to follow the standard build path or can I put my own twist on it?

if you think that twisting your builds according to the situation means playing not serious enough i have bad news for you, it's kind of mandatory

I'm referring to build changes bigger than just situational builds. For an example, whenever I play Veigar, I pretty much always buy Banner of Command second. That's not really something people do.

I also like to build Cho'gath AD. Again not the accepted thing.

Would those count as not taking the game seriously or they alright?

Yeah agree. I got placed with some REALLY ~~bad ~~ new players when the mmr reset. There were people raging at me for doing things that are just normal smart play. Like pushing out side lanes before you siege mid. Or itemizing differently than the top mobafire guide for you champion. Gotta believe you'd have people reporting players for trying out champs like {{champion:432}} in ranked for the first time (even with a handful of normal games under their belt). Not a fan of this idea.

Yeah.... This is dum. Normally people who take ranked too seriously are the first to throw a hissy for every little thing. After all this is ultimately a game. If you want to go pro, go join a team or something. Don't solo q and be surprised when there's a few people who really aren't going ham and are just playing LoL and happen to be playing in ranked instead of normals.

Heh to be honest I was actually being salty at you :P The reason was that you didn't differentiate between between people like me, that play to win, and try to do well in all their games unless given specific circumstances(e.g. hit it with premades and goof around) and people that are generally pricks no matter what and just live their lives looking for excuses to shit on everyone in a competitive invironment. Basically the equivalent of meatheads back in highschool but in beebee-oh gamez. On a sidenote I completely agree with you: the enemy team is here to have fun not put up with the 12 year old {{champion:103}} mid player that got ganked by top and complained about not calling missing despite the chat being filled with pings AND him not warding at all who proceeds to flame in /all .
This is why I avoid ranked games. I have only played like 15 all season. People in ranked throw get on you for every little mistake. I mostly just queue up with friends in teambuilder lol.

Had 4 Goldie's on my team (Just got Silver 2 and climbing) and they all raged at me for going amu support, yet they all fed. Spit on me and called me a "silver forever" I was 4-4 at the end they were like 4-8 and i got reported for offensive language lol... i didn't speak all game except my polite defense to their rude remarks. Not to mention they voted to surrender like 4 times. Surrender in ranked? Puh-leeze.

First time I've ever heard anyone say "goldies"

Interesting
Haha sorry didnt meant to seem mean just wanted to vent out a game a had {{champion:17}}

Had this Leblanc today, and like she seems to just pause at weird times, but wasn't lag.

Turns out it was some streamer with throusands of viewers. Probably busy typing stuff and/or chatting with fans,  instead of playing...

and what happens when salty people like you use it whenever someone has what you believe to be a sub par kd ratio?

how do you go about checking the validity of this? do you go on a case by case game by game basis where you watch replays of the games and determine this? or does some computer algorithm do some sort of crazy calculation and come up with an answer?
there should be a report option for "takes video games too seriously" it doesnt ban them, it just shuts their computers off and makes them go outside.

Reporting somebody for not taking a videogame seriously, lolwut.
This is the reason why we have so much toxicity, people take this game too seriously, it ruins the fun and creates tension.
I don't take ranked seriously, nor do I hardly even play it in the first place, should I get banned because I'm enjoying myself?
People wouldn't take the report seriously.

The @#$* you talkin bout bro? It's not serious until you get out of gold lol it's just laid back. And when I took it serious and played what I like I got flamed because someone didn't like the idea. I'll play ranked however the hell I want and if you don't like it you can smd. There's no law that says I have to do anything more than try to win that doesn't mean I have to take it seriously.

Would be cool but too easily abused.

Oh they had a bad game? I'll just report them for not taking ranked seriously so that the reportbots can restrict them.

Oh they played an off-meta pick? I'll just report them for not taking ranked seriously so that the reportbots can restrict them.
Maybe not completely restrict them from normals. But increase Que times for ranked games. Similarly to how they punish AFKers

Honestly I think people should be encouraged to ease up on how serious they take ranked. I am not saying be a dummy and throw the game, wander alone etc.

But I refuse to play ranked now because everyone is so pent up with stress that the smallest thing will set them off. If you die and are the first blood, you almost always have that 1 guy assume its GG. The quiet ones start losing hope, everyone's barely on tilt and it just sucks.

You get viewed as a feeder, unskilled, toxic etc from losing lane, trying to help someone, or not picking a champion that is considered good in the meta as opposed to a champion I would be skilled at.



So. Fuck this idea.

Agreed. Whenever I see anyone say "It's just a game" (especially in ranked) I just think of this:

http://i.imgur.com/fAUOr2c.png

I don't take ranked seriously.
Honestly. It's just a bunch of children.

(And before "that guy" shows up, this is my only account.)
